parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post does not contain a CMF number. While the absence of a CMF number is not automatically disqualifying, it suggests the post may not be directly linked to official electoral campaign materials.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post refers to Manolache Vasile, a senatorial candidate.  The phrase "Manolache Vasile - Senator" is used in the post's metadata and hashtags. This directly identifies a candidate participating in the elections.  Therefore, Article 36 (7) - a applies.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The targeting parameters (age, gender, location) further confirm its intention to address a broad segment of the population. Therefore, it addresses the wide population.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's core message encourages voters to support Manolache Vasile. Phrases like "momentul să demonstrăm că schimbarea este posibilă," "votăm pentru o România mai bună," and "lideri care prețuiesc oamenii" directly aim to influence voting behavior in favor of the candidate.  The hashtags "#ManolacheVasileSenator," "#SchimbarePentruOameni," and "#VotulContează" reinforce this objective.  Therefore, Article 36 (7) - c applies.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic content. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it promotes a specific candidate and advocates for their election. It is not educational in nature, nor does it provide information about the electoral process.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted message designed to persuade voters to support a specific candidate. The use of paid advertising further underscores its promotional intent.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>562051423431759</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers directly to a candidate (Manolache Vasile), is used during the electoral campaign period (as indicated by the ad's dates), has an explicitly electoral objective (persuading voters to support the candidate), and goes beyond journalistic reporting.  The paid nature of the Facebook post further strengthens this conclusion.  While the post doesn't explicitly urge voters to vote for or against the candidate at the polling station, its clear intention is to influence the vote in favor of Manolache Vasile before election day.  The targeting parameters suggest a calculated effort to reach potential voters.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Manolache Vasile</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>MOMENTUM</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Momentum Motion Pictures SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024 (ID postare: 562051423431759), care promovează candidatura lui Manolache Vasile la Senat, folosind mesaje persuasive precum „momentul să demonstrăm că schimbarea este posibilă” și „votăm pentru o România mai bună”, cu scopul clar de a influența votul în favoarea acestuia.  Reclama, cu o cheltuială de sub 100 RON, a vizat o audiență de 1000-2000 de impresii, cu o estimare a acoperirii de 100.000-500.000 de persoane, în principal în județul Bistrița-Năsăud, conform datelor din Facebook Ad Library.  Contact: contact@momentum.com.ro, +40767277777.  Această acțiune constituie propagandă electorală ilegală după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
